1509789326_1BgmsWcEitkkf96t5qVkBFPoYwdoc.body:
it would be more wise if CoinHive miner was enabled only on one tab per site, but as long as there's this one miner running all tabs on this site wouldn't display any ads.
The moment miner is killed ads are enabled again.

> [styromaniac](#comment_194_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): That's what they did: One tab running CoinHive so you don't see an ad banner on any tab.

Someone should make a small WebExtension and CRX that would replace CoinHive scripts on websites with its limited version instead of blocking it. I think the way either Decentraleyes or Local CDN do this, both are good ways to pull it off.
